alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Goshen and east central Platte Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 437 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Grayrocks Reservoir, or 16 miles east of Wheatland, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grayrocks Reservoir and Fort Laramie National Historic Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
